title: Rivian Roamer
text:
AI Policy for Rivian Roamer
 Effective Date: February 5, 2026
 Key Points (tl;dr)
 Here's what actually matters:
 AI assists development, it doesn't replace engineering - Every feature is designed, reviewed, tested, and shipped by a human engineer
 Your data is never sent to AI models - Vehicle telematics, location, personal information, and account data stay on our servers
 AI-enriched features will be clearly marked - If we introduce features powered by AI, you'll know and you can opt out
 One human is accountable - A real engineer owns every decision, not an algorithm
 How AI Is Used in Development
 AI tools are used as coding assistants during development, the same way an engineer might use a calculator, documentation, or a spell checker. These tools help with writing code, catching bugs, and exploring solutions faster.
 What AI does not do:
 Make product decisions
 Ship code without human review and testing
 Access production systems or customer data
 Replace engineering judgment or accountability
 Every line of code that reaches production is reviewed, tested, and approved by a professional software engineer. AI accelerates the work. It does not do the work unsupervised.
 How AI Is Used with Your Data
 It isn't.
 Your vehicle telematics, location history, driving data, personal information, and account details are never sent to third-party AI models or large language models. Your data stays on our infrastructure, processed by our code, under our control.
 AI-Enriched Features
 If we introduce features that use AI to enhance your experience (such as efficiency recommendations, trip suggestions, or predictive insights), we commit to the following:
 Clearly marked: AI-powered features will be identified so you know when AI is involved
 Opt-out available: You will always have the option to disable AI-enriched features
 Policy updated first: This policy will be updated before any AI-powered features launch
 Data handling disclosed: We will explain exactly what data is used and how
 As of today, Rivian Roamer has no customer-facing AI-powered features.
 Human Accountability
 Rivian Roamer is built and operated by a single engineer. There is no ambiguity about who is responsible for this product. AI is a tool in the toolbox, not a substitute for care, judgment, or accountability to the people who trust us with their data.
 Changes to This Policy
 If our use of AI changes materially, we will update this policy and notify customers before those changes take effect. You can always find the current version of this policy here.
 Questions?
 Email us at support@rivianroamer.com
 This action cannot be undone.
